claim: The person who was last to edit the post with ID 183 performed that edit using a mobile device while connected via cellular data.
extra_info: last to edit refers to MAX(LastEditDate);
reasoning: The claim references the device type ('mobile device') and connection method ('cellular data') used during the edit. The database schema contains no columns or tables tracking device type or network connection information. While the last editor and edit date for post 183 could be verified, the assertions about mobile device usage and cellular data connection are entirely out-of-schema and cannot be verified.

content.text:
I need to analyze this claim carefully. It makes two assertions:
1. There's a person who last edited post ID 183 (verifiable via LastEditDate)
2. That edit was performed "using a mobile device while connected via cellular data" (this references device type and connection type)

Let me check the database schema to see if device/connection information is tracked.

input.description: List all tables in the database

content.content:
badges       postHistory  posts        users      
comments     postLinks    tags         votes

tool_use_result.stdout:
badges       postHistory  posts        users      
comments     postLinks    tags         votes

content.content:
CREATE TABLE posts
(
    Id                    INTEGER          not null UNIQUE
        primary key,
    PostTypeId            INTEGER          null,
    AcceptedAnswerId      INTEGER          null,
    CreaionDate           DATETIME     null,
    Score                 INTEGER          null,
    ViewCount             INTEGER          null,
    Body                  TEXT     null,
    OwnerUserId           INTEGER          null,
    LasActivityDate       DATETIME     null,
    Title                 TEXT null,
    Tags                  TEXT null,
    AnswerCount           INTEGER          null,
    CommentCount          INTEGER          null,
    FavoriteCount         INTEGER          null,
    LastEditorUserId      INTEGER          null,
    LastEditDate          DATETIME     null,
    CommunityOwnedDate    DATETIME    null,
    ParentId              INTEGER          null,
    ClosedDate            DATETIME     null,
    OwnerDisplayName      TEXT null,
    LastEditorDisplayName TEXT null,
        foreign key (LastEditorUserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (OwnerUserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (ParentId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

tool_use_result.stdout:
CREATE TABLE posts
(
    Id                    INTEGER          not null UNIQUE
        primary key,
    PostTypeId            INTEGER          null,
    AcceptedAnswerId      INTEGER          null,
    CreaionDate           DATETIME     null,
    Score                 INTEGER          null,
    ViewCount             INTEGER          null,
    Body                  TEXT     null,
    OwnerUserId           INTEGER          null,
    LasActivityDate       DATETIME     null,
    Title                 TEXT null,
    Tags                  TEXT null,
    AnswerCount           INTEGER          null,
    CommentCount          INTEGER          null,
    FavoriteCount         INTEGER          null,
    LastEditorUserId      INTEGER          null,
    LastEditDate          DATETIME     null,
    CommunityOwnedDate    DATETIME    null,
    ParentId              INTEGER          null,
    ClosedDate            DATETIME     null,
    OwnerDisplayName      TEXT null,
    LastEditorDisplayName TEXT null,
        foreign key (LastEditorUserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (OwnerUserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (ParentId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.content:
CREATE TABLE postHistory
(
    Id                INTEGER          not null UNIQUE
        primary key,
    PostHistoryTypeId INTEGER          null,
    PostId            INTEGER          null,
    RevisionGUID      TEXT null,
    CreationDate      DATETIME     null,
    UserId            INTEGER          null,
    Text              TEXT     null,
    Comment           TEXT         null,
    UserDisplayName   TEXT null,
        foreign key (PostId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (UserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

tool_use_result.stdout:
CREATE TABLE postHistory
(
    Id                INTEGER          not null UNIQUE
        primary key,
    PostHistoryTypeId INTEGER          null,
    PostId            INTEGER          null,
    RevisionGUID      TEXT null,
    CreationDate      DATETIME     null,
    UserId            INTEGER          null,
    Text              TEXT     null,
    Comment           TEXT         null,
    UserDisplayName   TEXT null,
        foreign key (PostId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (UserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.text:
The claim asserts that the edit was performed "using a mobile device while connected via cellular data." The database schema has no columns or tables tracking:
- Device type (mobile, desktop, etc.)
- Connection type (cellular data, WiFi, etc.)

This information is completely **out-of-schema**. While the database tracks *who* last edited and *when*, it has no information about the device or network used.

```json
{"label": "NOT ENOUGH INFO", "reasoning": "The claim references the device type ('mobile device') and connection method ('cellular data') used during the edit. The database schema contains no columns or tables tracking device type or network connection information. While the last editor and edit date for post 183 could be verified, the assertions about mobile device usage and cellular data connection are entirely out-of-schema and cannot be verified."}
```
